name: kafka
description: Apache Kafka is a distributed streaming platform designed to build real-time pipelines and can be used as a message broker or as a replacement for a shared database.
values:
# Kafka configuration
# Ref: https://github.com/bitnami/charts/blob/main/bitnami/kafka/values.yaml

## Global settings
global:
  imageRegistry: ""
  imagePullSecrets: []
  storageClass: ""

## Kafka configuration
kafka:
  ## Authentication in Kafka
  auth:
    clientProtocol: plain  # Possible values: plain, tls, mtls, sasl, oauthbearer
    interBrokerProtocol: plain
    
  ## Authorization in Kafka
  authorization:
    type: none  # Possible values: none, simple
    
  ## Kafka deployment configuration
  replicaCount: 3
  
  ## Kafka listeners configuration
  listeners:
    client:
      name: CLIENT
      port: 9092
      protocol: PLAINTEXT
    external:
      name: EXTERNAL
      port: 9094
      protocol: PLAINTEXT
      type: loadBalancer
  
  ## Persistence configuration
  persistence:
    enabled: true
    size: 8Gi
    storageClass: ""
  
  ## Resources configuration
  resources:
    limits:
      cpu: 1000m
      memory: 2Gi
    requests:
      cpu: 500m
      memory: 1Gi
  
  ## JVM configuration
  heapOpts: "-Xmx1024m -Xms1024m"

## Zookeeper settings
zookeeper:
  enabled: true
  replicaCount: 3
  
  persistence:
    enabled: true
    size: 8Gi
    storageClass: ""
  
  resources:
    limits:
      cpu: 500m
      memory: 512Mi
    requests:
      cpu: 250m
      memory: 256Mi
  
  heapSize: 256

## Metrics configuration
metrics:
  kafka:
    enabled: false
    
  zookeeper:
    enabled: false
    
  jmx:
    enabled: false
  
## Network Policy configuration
networkPolicy:
  enabled: false
